verses.text_plain: Lord, remember David, and all his afflictions:
verses.verse_html: 1Lord, remember David, and all his afflictions:

verses.text_plain: How he sware unto the Lord, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;
verses.verse_html: 2How he sware unto the Lord, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;

verses.text_plain: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;
verses.verse_html: 3Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;

verses.text_plain: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,
verses.verse_html: 4I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,

verses.text_plain: Until I find out a place for the Lord, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
verses.verse_html:
5Until I find out a place for the Lord, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob. ▼
▼ an habitation: Heb. habitations

footnotes.body_html: ▼ an habitation: Heb. habitations

verses.text_plain: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.
verses.verse_html: 6Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.

verses.text_plain: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.
verses.verse_html: 7We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.

verses.text_plain: Arise, O Lord, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.
verses.verse_html: 8Arise, O Lord, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.

verses.text_plain: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.
verses.verse_html: 9Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.

verses.text_plain: For thy servant David’s sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.
verses.verse_html: 10For thy servant David’s sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.

verses.text_plain: The Lord hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.
verses.verse_html:
11The Lord hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne. ▼
▼ body: Heb. belly

verses.text_plain: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.
verses.verse_html: 12If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.

verses.text_plain: For the Lord hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.
verses.verse_html: 13For the Lord hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.

verses.text_plain: This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.
verses.verse_html: 14This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

verses.text_plain: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.
verses.verse_html:
15I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread. ▼
▼ abundantly: or, surely

verses.text_plain: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
verses.verse_html: 16I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

verses.text_plain: There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.
verses.verse_html:
17There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed. ▼
▼ lamp: or, candle

verses.text_plain: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.
verses.verse_html: 18His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

tokens.text: but upon himself shall his crown
